geoHubs.tooltip:
Geopolitical Activity Hubs
Shows regions with the most news activity.

Hub types:
‚Ä¢ üèõÔ∏è Capitals ‚Äî World capitals and government centers
‚Ä¢ ‚öîÔ∏è Conflict Zones ‚Äî Active conflict areas
‚Ä¢ ‚öì Strategic ‚Äî Chokepoints and key regions
‚Ä¢ üè¢ Organizations ‚Äî UN, NATO, IAEA, etc.

Activity levels:

‚Ä¢ Low ‚Äî Score below 40

Click a hub to zoom to its location.

predictions.tooltip:
Prediction Markets
Real-money forecasting markets:
  • Prices reflect crowd probability estimates
  • Higher volume = more reliable signal
  • Geopolitical and current events focus
Source: Polymarket (polymarket.com)

strategicPosture.infoTooltip:
Methodology

Aggregates military aircraft and naval vessels by theater.

  • Normal: Baseline activity
  • Elevated: Above threshold (50+ aircraft)
  • Critical: High concentration (100+ aircraft)

Strike Capable: Tankers + AWACS + Fighters present in sufficient numbers for sustained operations.

descriptions.techStartupHubs: Major startup ecosystems (SF, NYC, London, etc.)
descriptions.techCloudRegions: AWS, Azure, GCP data center regions
descriptions.infraCables: Major undersea fiber optic cables (internet backbone)
descriptions.naturalEventsTech: Earthquakes, storms, fires (may affect data centers)
descriptions.financeExchanges: Major global exchanges by market tier
descriptions.financeCommodityHubs: Key exchanges, ports, and refining hubs
descriptions.financeCables: Major undersea fiber routes tied to market infrastructure
descriptions.financePipelines: Oil/gas pipeline routes affecting energy markets
descriptions.financeOutages: Internet disruptions that can impact market operations
descriptions.weatherAlertsMarket: Severe weather events with market relevance
descriptions.naturalEventsMacro: Earthquakes, fires, floods, and other natural disruptions
descriptions.timeRecent: Filter time-based data to recent hours
descriptions.timeExtended: Show data from past week, month, or all time
descriptions.geoConflicts: Active war zones (Ukraine, Gaza, etc.) with boundaries
descriptions.geoHotspots: Tension regions - color-coded by news activity level
descriptions.militaryActivity: Live military aircraft and vessel tracking
descriptions.infraCablesFull: Major undersea fiber optic cables (20 backbone routes)
descriptions.naturalEventsFull: Earthquakes (USGS) + storms, fires, volcanoes, floods (NASA EONET)

cii.infoTooltip:
Methodology
  • Unrest: civil disorder & protests
  • Conflict: armed conflict intensity
  • Security: military flights/vessels over territory
  • Information: news velocity and focal point correlation
  • Hotspot proximity boost (strategic locations)
U:C:S:I values show component scores. Focal Point Detection correlates news entities with map signals for accurate scoring.

insights.noStories: No breaking or multi-source stories yet
insights.infoTooltip:
AI-Powered Analysis
‚Ä¢ World Brief: AI summary (Groq/OpenRouter)
‚Ä¢ Sentiment: News tone analysis
‚Ä¢ Velocity: Fast-moving stories
‚Ä¢ Focal Points: Correlates news entities with map signals (military, protests, outages)
Desktop only ‚Ä¢ Powered by Llama 3.3 + Focal Point Detection

cascade.selectInfrastructureHint: Select infrastructure to analyze cascade impact
cascade.infoTooltip:
Cascade Analysis Models infrastructure dependencies:
  • Subsea cables, pipelines, ports, chokepoints
  • Select infrastructure to simulate failure
  • Shows affected countries and capacity loss
  • Identifies redundant routes
Data from TeleGeography and industry sources.

strategicRisk.infoTooltip:
Methodology Composite score (0-100) blending:
  • 50% Country Instability (top 5 weighted)
  • 30% Geographic convergence zones
  • 20% Infrastructure incidents
Auto-refreshes every 5 minutes.

techReadiness.infoTooltip:
Global Tech Readiness
Composite score (0-100) based on World Bank data:

Metrics shown:
üåê Internet Users (% of population)
üì± Mobile Subscriptions (per 100 people)
üî¨ R&D Expenditure (% of GDP)

Weights: R&D (35%), Internet (30%), Broadband (20%), Mobile (15%)

‚Äî = No recent data available
Source: World Bank Open Data (2019-2024)

populationExposure.infoTooltip:
Population Exposure Estimates Estimated population within event impact radius. Based on WorldPop country density data.
  • Conflict: 50km radius
  • Earthquake: 100km radius
  • Flood: 100km radius
  • Wildfire: 30km radius

satelliteFires.infoTooltip: NASA FIRMS VIIRS satellite thermal detections across monitored conflict regions. High-intensity = brightness >360K & confidence >80%.

ucdpEvents.infoTooltip:
UCDP Georeferenced Events Event-level conflict data from Uppsala University.
  • State-Based: Government vs rebel group
  • Non-State: Armed group vs armed group
  • One-Sided: Violence against civilians
Deaths shown as best estimate (low-high range). ACLED duplicates are filtered out automatically.

displacement.infoTooltip:
UNHCR Displacement Data Global refugee, asylum seeker, and IDP counts from UNHCR.
  • Origins: Countries people flee FROM
  • Hosts: Countries hosting refugees
  • Crisis badges: >1M | High: >500K displaced
Data updates yearly. CC BY 4.0 license.

climate.infoTooltip:
Climate Anomaly Monitor Temperature and precipitation deviations from 30-day baseline. Data from Open-Meteo (ERA5 reanalysis).
  • Extreme: >5¬∞C or >80mm/day deviation
  • Moderate: >3¬∞C or >40mm/day deviation
Monitors 15 conflict/disaster-prone zones.

gdeltIntel.infoTooltip:
GDELT Intelligence Real-time global news monitoring:
  • Curated topic categories (conflicts, cyber, etc.)
  • Articles from 100+ languages translated
  • Updates every 15 minutes
Source: GDELT Project (gdeltproject.org)

investments.infoTooltip: Database of Saudi Arabia and UAE foreign direct investments in global critical infrastructure. Click a row to fly to the investment on the map.

prediction.infoTooltip:
Prediction Markets Real-money forecasting markets:
  • Prices reflect crowd probability estimates
  • Higher volume = more reliable signal
  • Geopolitical and current events focus
Source: Polymarket (polymarket.com)

apt.description: Advanced Persistent Threat group with state-level capabilities. Known for sophisticated cyber operations targeting critical infrastructure, government, and defense sectors.

nuclear.description: Nuclear facility under monitoring. Strategic importance for regional security and non-proliferation concerns.

irradiator.subtitle: Industrial Gamma Irradiator Facility
irradiator.description: Industrial irradiation facility using Cobalt-60 or Cesium-137 sources for medical device sterilization, food preservation, or material processing. Source: IAEA DIIF Database.

cable.subtitle: Undersea Fiber Optic Cable
cable.description: Undersea telecommunications cable carrying international internet traffic. These fiber optic cables form the backbone of global internet connectivity, transmitting over 95% of intercontinental data.

repairShip.note: Repair vessel tracking indicates active deployment toward fault site.
repairShip.description: Repair ship tracking indicates active deployment in support of undersea cable restoration.
